content.description: This is one of the easiest steeper climbs at the crag, offers many good rests and nice jugs
content.location: Smack dab in the middle of the Left of the Roof Section

content.description: Fun crimping from the start leads to easier climbing before the first crux midway up the route.  The final crux comes at the roof near the end.
content.location:
Route is immediately right of

Flesh and Blood

at the far left side of the "Left of the Roof Area"

content.description: After moving off the initial undercling onto crimps, hit a slopey right leaning flake and move up onto two more crimps to pull the technical transition onto a prominent sidepull and/or undercling. Continue up on some much appreciated liebacks into another thin section, eventually hitting what feels like the second crux on a 3 finger pocket up to a two finger pocket. From there the route leans in for an easy slab finish. Fun and varied climbing throughout, good footwork will go along way.
content.location:
Located just left of

Inspiration

(5.11c/d) and two bolt lines to the right of the popular

Trundle Trophy

(5.10d). Starts at a large flake/underling (not the right-facing lieback flake that is Inspiration).

content.description:
After climbing inspiration (11d) head up following the left line of bolts. Use long runners or skip the bolts at the ledge where the anchors of Inspiration are. Avoiding rope drag is the name of the game on this climb.

Would be an excellent climb if it was not for the abundant bird droppings below the left leaning hand crack.
content.location:
Inspiration starts 10 feet left of Flexercise 10b.

Caution! Using a rope 80m or shorter, LPL to the anchor of Trundle Trophy 10d (slightly to your left).

content.description:
This climb is fun. There is no real crux just solid 5.10 climbing from the moment you start until the last move up to the anchors.

The climbing is mainly on small flakes, but it is mixed in with some stemming halfway up.

Starts of with lay backs on good holds till you pass the 4th bolt, leading into a depression. Clipping 5th bolt is a reach for 5'5 and under. Crux is moving from 5th to 6th bolt, then easy climbing to the anchors.
content.location:
Located right of

Master Blaster

. Has "Inspiration" and "11d" written on front of it. Shares same anchors with Master Blaster.

content.description: This route is an incredible and long moderate route, even by quarry standards. The route has two distinct cruxes, one at the bottom and one at the top, separated by sixty or so feet of fun climbing on good holds in stellar position. The climb starts on small holds under a bulge. Traverse right and up, then around the bulge to jugs. Continue over a series of ledges on good holds while the climb edges closer to the left-hand arete. After a nice rest on a small ledge 2/3's the way up, you pull a move up to a large slanting ledge and throw for a jug in the middle. Traverse right under the looming roof and prepare to surmount it up and left. A strenuous sequence here rewards you with the headwall and big holds to the anchors at the top of the cliff.
content.protection: 16 bolts to two-bolt anchor/rap. 70m rope recommended. You can climb this route with a 60m rope, but tie a knot on the belay-end when lowering and be very careful.
content.location: This is the first route in the Left of the Roof Sector. It's just around the corner from Metro.  It starts directly in front of a bench which sits in front of a medium sized boulder. Currently the rating 11b is written on the wall at the bottom of the route.

content.description:
Route is currently closed due to loose rock!

The crux is just above the second bolt and involves two dynamic moves in a row.  The rest of the route is fun, but much easier.

Crimpy moves off the ground continue through some long reaches and strong moves. Few positive feet with lots of smears while pulling side pulls. Finishes with a long move to a jug (comparatively) and a slab up to anchors. Very continuous to that point.

Optional easier finish right on Master Blaster after the 3rd bolt (original set up).
content.location: Located between Trundle Trophy and Master Blaster.

content.description: Low first bolt (which I personally think could have been place a little higher). Crux is a V3+ "bouldery" move getting to 2nd bolt. Rest is pretty easy climbing to no hands rest where anchors to Inspiration is located. Another crux up top, but like any quarry climbs there is jugs right after to a no hands rest.
content.location:
Located in between

Inspiration

and

Flexercise

content.description:
Route is currently closed due to loose rock!

Tricky footwork, body tension and good hold selection will get you through the first 4 bolts. The climbing eases up with a few harder sections on the rest of the climb. A crimp crux before the mid anchor can be challenging if pumped. Keep going past the anchors out left and finish all the way at the top of the cliff.
content.protection: 17 bolts to ring anchors. There is also a midway ring anchor to the left of the route.
content.location: This is located left of Choss Revolution. A few routes to the left of the popular Trundle Trophy and Flexercise.

content.description: Multiple thin cruxes make for sustained climbing with the final crux coming just after the 100' anchors.  Great climbing after the 100' anchors so make sure to go all the way to the top!  If lowering with anything other than an 80m rope, lower to the 100' anchors, pull, then lower from there.
content.protection: 16 bolts to a double ring anchor
content.location: Five feet right of Culture Shock at the base of a gold streaked face

content.description: Climb through several bulges and several strenuous sequences before coming to a rest ledge at about the 10th bolt.  A tricky move to gain access to the ledge marks the start of the cruxy climbing.  Serious power and endurance is needed to work through the roof and remaining clmbing to the anchors.
content.location: Route is located to the right of Raging Raptor.

content.description: Solid crimpy sequence off the ground leads to some long and/or technical moves. Shallows out a bit for some easy flake climbing to some steep jugs all for an interesting finish which will require some creative footwork on some slopey arete/dihedral.
content.protection: 12-15 bolts with double ring anchors at the top.
content.location: Directly right of the popular warm-up Flexercise.
